definition: to overturn trunks and boxes/to make a thorough search (idiom)
to turn over/to flip over/to overturn/to rummage through/to translate/to decode/to double/to climb over or into/to cross
to place upside down/to invert/to pour/to throw out/to move backwards/however/actually/as a matter of fact/contrary to expectation
to fall/to collapse/to lie horizontally/to overthrow/to fail/to go bankrupt/to change (trains or buses)/to move around/to resell at a profit

sentences.english: She hurried home and turned everything topsy-turvy to find the lives to save.
sentences.chinese: 余老夫人急忙赶回家，翻箱倒柜地找待救之物。

sentences.english: She rummaged change from the bottom of her purse .
sentences.chinese: 她翻箱倒柜的在底部寻找到她的钱包。

sentences.english: But the police just came through the gate and did this.
sentences.chinese: 但那时那些警察就是二话不说冲进来，翻箱倒柜。

sentences.english: He moped for days after he discovered they were missing.
sentences.chinese: 发现眼镜不见了时他翻箱倒柜找了好几天。

sentences.english: But how? Someone could have rummaged in my things and found the quatrain.
sentences.chinese: 怎么找，被人翻箱倒柜搜索到四行诗。

sentences.english: My room was in a state of disorder after I searched through it for my favorite shoes.
sentences.chinese: 翻箱倒柜找完我心爱的鞋子后，我的房间一片狼藉。

sentences.english: She hurried home and turned everything topsy-turvy to find the lives to save .
sentences.chinese: 余老夫人急赶回家，翻箱倒柜地找待救之物。

sentences.english: He rummages through a cupboard and retrieves a flashlight.
sentences.chinese: 他翻箱倒柜，找出一个手电筒。

sentences.english: I rummaged three drawers before I found my gloves.
sentences.chinese: 我翻箱倒柜地找了三个抽屉才找到手套。

definition: to rummage through/to turn everything over/to ransack
to browse and select/to glance through and check
to go from house to house
to move/to shift/to exchange/to buy and sell/peddling
to rush out through a door (idiom)
to clear up/to tidy up/to pick up/to repair
to fiddle with sth/to trade with sth
